sense.name: a person who contracts to transport by road
sense.commentary: HAULER[+person][+contractor][+transporter][+road][+material/+goods] Note: references a person, not a business
sense.examples: He was an independent hauler with his own rig. Those haulers are going on strike for better wages from their firm.

sense.name: a business that transports material or goods by road
sense.commentary: HAULER[+business][+transporter][+road][+material/+goods] Note: references an organization, not a single individual
sense.examples: Small local haulers collect the bagged or bundled waste. It's a national hauler that transports a lot of farm produce.

sense.name: a truck used to transport material or goods via road
sense.commentary: HAULER[+vehicle][+truck][+transporter][+material/+goods] Note: references a vehicle, a truck
sense.examples: There was a line of haulers moving up the road, carrying loads of gravel and sand. A liquid gas hauler jackknifed on the freeway during the ice storm.
